intro: Paracladopus chiangmaiensis, commonly known as the Chiang Mai paracladopus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of northern Thailand. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in secondary forest understories. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are unisexual and arranged in compact inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
